title: Yaya Toure explains why he joined Manchester City as Ivorian says he is still eyeing the treble
text:
Sport Yaya Toure explains why he joined Manchester City as Ivorian says he is still eyeing the treble The 33-year-old arrived at the Etihad Stadium from Barcelona in 2010 and has helped City to two Premier League titles Share Love affair - Yaya Toure has revealed why he joined Manchester City in 2010 (Photo: Getty Images) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Yaya Toure has admitted he had rivals Manchester United in mind when he first arrived at the Etihad. 
The veteran midfielder has helped guide Manchester City to their first Premier League titles as well as winning the FA Cup and two League Cup titles in six and a half years at the club. 
And the Ivorian has said it was the ambition to out-gun their famous neighbours that first attracted him to the blue half of the city. 
“My time here has been great,” the Ivorian told the club's official website . “My mentality has always been the same. I always enjoy it. The Ivorian midfielder tucks away a penalty in City's win over West Ham (Photo: AFP) Toure holds his second Premier League trophy with Manuel Pellegrini in May 2014 (Photo: Getty) 
“The plan of this club in the beginning was to try to get players to win, to change the club into a winning machine like Manchester United or Barcelona . 
“That’s what made me decide to come here because what the club was trying to do was bring in big players - winning players." 
Toure has re-established himself himself as an important part of the City squad after being left out in the cold by Pep Guardiola , the man who sold him to the Etihad from Barcelona, for the first three months of the season. Toure has said he is still hungry for more trophies (Photo: Getty) 
And despite already writing himself in the club's history with his achievements, he is hungry for more success in on three fronts this season. 
"We’re looking forward. We still have competitions coming - the Champions League, the FA Cup - and we’re going to try to do our best for those guys who come to watch and enjoy football. 
“My mentality is always like that. I try, at the end of the season, to lift a trophy - it’s one of the most beautiful things that can happen to me."
